pull_request.title: BIKE-1 code update
pull_request.body:
This PR includes the latest code of BIKE.

1) It solves https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/636 (See the same change in  https://github.com/awslabs/s2n/pull/1527/commits/affc647a5d9b3e89cb2c6a57d0b0f0c10066a488)
2) It uses short license headers
3) Some formatting changes that happen due to applying `astyle` on the latest code instead of applying clang-format as before.

pull_request.title: Add -g3 debug information to ASAN builds
pull_request.body: This should help track where it's crashing

pull_request.title: Add -g3 debug information to ASAN builds
pull_request.body:
This should help track where it's crashing.

Not entirely sure on how CMake manages flags, might be a better way to handle this.

pull_request.title: Allow Linux and MacOs to consume this wrapper without issues
pull_request.body:
This pull request contains codes that allow Linux and macOS to consume this wrapper.

The changes are: (Updated)

1. ~~Addition of Lib_OQS_KEM_* and Lib_OQS_SIG_* methods for both Linux and macOS. (They are essentially pointed to the original signature in DllImport)~~
[Update] I have found out that DllImport actually prepend "lib" into library names for linux and macOS. However, they have to be exact as in "liboqs.so" is not equals to "liboqs.so.0.0.0" As a result, the changes would just be [DllImport("oqs")] instead. (If you want to support the versioning, AssemblyLoadContext would be needed)

2. Changed target frameworks to netstandard1.2 and netstandard2.0 allowing different version of .Net Core and .Net framework version to use this library. (netstandard1.2 is added for compatibility with the existing test case for netcoreapp1.1)

3. Removed prebuild event for all projects except test case to allow other OS to execute the new dotnet cli commands.

4. Addition of some useful scripts that can be used for reference for building this project. (Consist of Windows, Linux and macOS variants)

5. Updated documentation in README.md to have a slightly more verbose information on how to build the sample application and the wrapper.

Sample Application Tested on:
- [x] Windows 10
- [x] Linux (Ubuntu 18.04 LTS)
- [x] macOS (Mojave)

Relevant issues: #2 #10

repo.name: liboqs-csharp
repo.description: [work in progress] C# bindings for liboqs
